Keywords: Skrulls , Spy
Real Name: Various
Special Powers
MOVEMENT: Hindering
ASSUME YOUR FORM: FREE: If this character hasn't been moved or placed this turn, choose a standard opposing character within 4 squares and line of fire that has not been chosen by this effect this turn. Both players roll a d6. If your result is higher, place Skrull Infiltrator and the chosen character in each other's squares.

Comments
February 19, 2021
Goop
These guys are going to be a pain to kill. Stealth SS and Shape change +1 thanks to Skrull TA. Not very offensive but at only 20pts you can put enough of these on map to make your opponent cry.
November 11, 2020
tidge
These Infiltrators should make good footsoldiers for a Skrull Invasion force. The cost is not radically out-of-line with other 'generics'; for 3-clicks with such stats & powers I don't want to pay more than 20 points. With Precision Strike they stand a chance at actually hurting most figures. I feel that printed 4-range is a bit of a disappointment; I can accept it as a hard limit for the trait, but a 4-square range for attacks is not good for swarm forces with no inherent move+attack options and whose 'leader' pieces have a longer range. The ASSUME YOUR FORM is a very neat trick that leans into the meta-narrative of Skrulls as living-or-dying by d6 rolls.
September 7, 2020

August 7, 2020
surrealhero1019
For 20 points you get three chances at evading an attack (barring abilities that ignore SC/SS). You also get a shot at switching places with your target. For 20 points. I love these guys, and I especially love how well they play with the other Skrulls in this set.
